filmography.title: Dancing Lady
filmography.role_description: A fictionalized version of himself, a talented dancer who is hired to partner with the female lead in a Broadway show.
filmography.plot: A burlesque dancer is bailed out of jail by a rich playboy and gets a shot at Broadway stardom.

filmography.title: Flying Down to Rio
filmography.role_description: An accordion-playing assistant bandleader who, along with his partner, steals the show with the 'Carioca' number.
filmography.plot: A love triangle involving a bandleader, a beautiful Brazilian woman, and his best friend plays out against the backdrop of a hotel opening in Rio.

filmography.title: The Gay Divorcee
filmography.role_description: A renowned American dancer vacationing in England who is mistaken for a professional co-respondent in a divorce case.
filmography.plot: A woman thinks a flirting man is the co-respondent her lawyer has hired to expedite her divorce.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('The Continental')

filmography.title: Roberta
filmography.role_description: An American bandleader in Paris who finds himself running a high-fashion house with his friend.
filmography.plot: A football player inherits a Paris fashion house and decides to run it with the help of his bandleader friend.

filmography.title: Top Hat
filmography.role_description: An American dancer who falls for a woman who mistakenly believes he is her friend's husband, leading to a comedy of errors in London and Venice.
filmography.plot: An American dancer comes to Britain and falls for a model whom he initially annoyed, but she mistakes him for his goofy producer.

filmography.title: Follow the Fleet
filmography.role_description: A gum-chewing sailor and former dancer who tries to rekindle a romance with his former partner while on shore leave.
filmography.plot: Two sailors on shore leave in San Francisco get mixed up with two sisters, one a singer and the other a plain-jane.

filmography.title: Swing Time
filmography.role_description: A gambler and dancer who goes to New York to earn enough money to marry his fiancée, only to fall for a dance instructor.
filmography.plot: A performer and gambler travels to New York City to raise the $25,000 he needs to marry his fiancée, only to become entangled with a beautiful dance instructor.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('The Way You Look Tonight')

filmography.title: Shall We Dance
filmography.role_description: An American ballet dancer who adopts a Russian persona and falls for a tap dancer, leading to rumors that they are secretly married.
filmography.plot: A ballet dancer and a tap dancer fake a marriage for publicity purposes, but eventually fall in love.

filmography.title: Carefree
filmography.role_description: A psychiatrist who attempts to analyze his friend's fiancée, only to have her fall in love with him under hypnosis.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist tries to help a friend's indecisive fiancée, but she falls for the doctor instead.

filmography.title: Broadway Melody of 1940
filmography.role_description: A talented dancer who is mistakenly overlooked for a lead role due to a mix-up, but proves his worth through spectacular tap numbers.
filmography.plot: A professional dance duo is split up when one is mistaken for the other and offered a starring role in a Broadway show.

filmography.title: Second Chorus
filmography.role_description: A trumpet-playing college student who competes with his friend for a job in Artie Shaw's band and the affections of their manager.
filmography.plot: Two competitive trumpet players vie for the same job and the same girl.

filmography.title: You'll Never Get Rich
filmography.role_description: A Broadway choreographer drafted into the army who creates a show and falls for his producer's girlfriend.
filmography.plot: A choreographer is drafted into the army, but his producer makes sure he stays close to the show—and the producer's girlfriend.

filmography.title: Holiday Inn
filmography.role_description: A smooth, ambitious dancer who repeatedly steals his partner's girlfriends, setting up a rivalry at a holiday-themed Connecticut inn.
filmography.plot: At an inn which is open only on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('White Christmas')

filmography.title: You Were Never Lovelier
filmography.role_description: A dancer in Buenos Aires who is hired by a wealthy father to romance his daughter, though the two initially dislike each other.
filmography.plot: In Buenos Aires, a dancer falls for a wealthy girl whose father is trying to arrange a marriage for her.

filmography.title: The Sky's the Limit
filmography.role_description: A Flying Tiger pilot on leave who hides his identity to pursue a romance with a photographer before returning to combat.
filmography.plot: A war hero on leave incognito falls for a photographer who thinks he's a drifter.

filmography.title: Blue Skies
filmography.role_description: A radio star and hoofer who narrates the story of his rivalry with a singer over the same woman spanning decades.
filmography.plot: A dancer and a singer compete for the love of a beautiful showgirl over the course of several years.

filmography.title: Easter Parade
filmography.role_description: A dancer who, after being dumped by his partner, bets that he can transform a naive chorus girl into a star in time for the Easter Parade.
filmography.plot: A nightclub performer hires a naive chorus girl to become his new partner to make his former partner jealous.

filmography.title: The Barkleys of Broadway
filmography.role_description: Half of a successful musical comedy team who struggles when his wife and partner decides to leave the act to become a serious dramatic actress.
filmography.plot: A musical comedy team threatens to break up when the wife decides she wants to be a serious dramatic actress.

filmography.title: Three Little Words
filmography.role_description: The real-life vaudevillian turned lyricist who forms a tempestuous but successful songwriting partnership with Harry Ruby.
filmography.plot: The biography of the successful Tin Pan Alley songwriting team of Bert Kalmar and Harry Ruby.

filmography.title: Royal Wedding
filmography.role_description: A dancer who travels to London with his sister for the Royal Wedding and falls in love, featuring the famous ceiling dance.
filmography.plot: A brother and sister dance act encounter challenges and romance when they take their show to London during the Royal Wedding.

filmography.title: The Band Wagon
filmography.role_description: A washed-up movie star who tries to restart his career on Broadway, battling an artsy director and a prima ballerina co-star.
filmography.plot: A pretentious artistic director is hired for a new Broadway musical and changes it beyond recognition.

filmography.title: Daddy Long Legs
filmography.role_description: A wealthy American playboy who anonymously sponsors the education of a French orphan, eventually falling in love with her.
filmography.plot: A wealthy American has a chance encounter with a young French woman and anonymously pays for her education.

filmography.title: Funny Face
filmography.role_description: A fashion photographer based on Richard Avedon who discovers a shy bookstore clerk and transforms her into a model in Paris.
filmography.plot: An impromptu fashion shoot at a book store brings about a new fashion standard and a new muse.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Silk Stockings
filmography.role_description: An American movie producer in Paris who charms a stern Soviet official sent to retrieve three wayward composers.
filmography.plot: A musical remake of 'Ninotchka': A Soviet official is sent to Paris to retrieve three wayward composers but is charmed by the capitalist lifestyle.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture (Comedy/Musical)

filmography.title: On the Beach
filmography.role_description: A cynical, guilt-ridden nuclear scientist in Australia who races racing cars while awaiting the radioactive fallout from World War III.
filmography.plot: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

filmography.title: Finian's Rainbow
filmography.role_description: An Irish wanderer who steals a leprechaun's pot of gold and travels to the American South to bury it near Fort Knox.
filmography.plot: An Irishman steals a leprechaun's pot of gold and emigrates to America with his daughter.

filmography.title: The Towering Inferno
filmography.role_description: A con man who attempts to sell fake bonds to a wealthy widow during the opening party of a doomed skyscraper.
filmography.plot: At the opening party of a colossal, but poorly constructed, office building, a massive fire breaks out, threatening to destroy the tower and everyone in it.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Ghost Story
filmography.role_description: One of four elderly men in the Chowder Society who are haunted by a dark secret from their youth involving a woman's death.
filmography.plot: Four successful elderly men are haunted by a dark secret from their past involving the death of a young woman.
